intro: Mediolobivia haagei var. digitiformis, commonly known as the digitate lobelia, is a unique plant with distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its lobed leaves that resemble fingers, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
